comment.author: 7161314@N04
comment._content: It's worth noting that this is taken from within the Dawes Point Battery walls. See cannon mounting at mid-right of shot.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The closest ship is the SS Ranelagh. A watercolour - www.slv.vic.gov.au/pictoria/b/4/5/doc/b45818.shtml Scene of a tragedy in 1882 - freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~swadling/famhi...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'm not 100% sure, but I suspect that the buildings in the foreground, off to the lhs, might be the Commercial Rowing Club shed and clubhouse...which were located at Dawes Point for a number of years...from April 1875 thru to ca. July 1910 I gather...the Sydney Mail, 26/10/1878 (p. 649) has an illustration [this issue isn't available via Google News Archive]...the accompanying article states that the club was 'situated on the south-easern end of Dawes Point, which has lately been greatly improved by the reclamation of considerable water frontage and by the erection of a sea-wall'...the SLNSW has a wonderful pic, which looks to predate the improvements mentioned in the 1878 Sydney Mail article and depicted in the illustration...ie. the NLNSW pic evidently dates from ca. 1875 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=412240

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] I am sure you mean the Mercantile Rowing Club, shown on this 1895 interactive map (usually reliable in detail) as "M.R.C." www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Woops! Yes, I should have put Mercantile Rowing Club. Thanks for picking that up! I'm fairly certain that this bloke was a MRC rower - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2376880552/. I gather we also see the MRC buildings in this pic as well - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362654055/

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's an 1886 T&CJ item which includes a sketch of the Mercantile Rowing Club sheds at Dawes Point - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71067577 ; and also an 1890 Illustrated News article...shame about the pic quality - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article63610899
